description: rises in SE Chatham County and flows S into Cape Fear River.

label: Shade Branch
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SW into Martin Branch.

label: Shadepen Branch
description: rises in NW Buncombe County and flows SE into North Fork [Swannanoa River].

label: Shadrick Creek
description: rises in E McDowell County and flows E approx. 5 mi. into Old Catawba River in SW Burke County.

label: Shady Banks
description: community in central Beaufort County on the N bank of Pamlico River.

label: Shady Grove
description: community in N Yadkin County. Named for a Baptist church.

label: Shady Grove
description: See Advance.

label: Shady Grove Township
description: E Davie County. Named for Shady Grove Methodist Church, est. prior to or in 1816.

label: Shadygrove
description: community in NW Sampson County.

label: Shaftesbury Precinct
description: was formed by 1668 as a division of Albemarle County. It was named for Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of Shaftesbury (1621-83), one of the original Lords Proprietors of Carolina. Renamed Chowan Precinct about 1681. See also Chowan County.

label: Shaken
description: community in NE Pender County on Shaken Creek E of its junction with Holly Shelter Creek. Served by post office, 1907-18.

label: Shaken Creek
description: rises in E Pender County and flows NW into Holly Shelter Creek.

label: Shakerag
description: See Osgood.

label: Shaleville
description: community in W Madison County on Ferry Branch.

label: Shallop's Landing
description: See Columbia.

label: Shallotte
description: town in SW Brunswick County served by post office since 1837. Appears on the Morse-Breese map, 1843. Inc. 1899. Named for Shallotte River, on which it is located. Alt. 33.

label: Shallotte Creek
description: rises in S Brunswick County and flows W into Shallotte River.

label: Shallotte Inlet
description: SW Brunswick County between Big Beach and Hales Beach connecting Long Bay in the Atlantic Ocean with the mouths of Shallotte River, Shallotte Creek, and Saucepan Creek. Provides access to the Intracoastal Waterway from the Atlantic Ocean.

label: Shallotte River
description: rises in SW Brunswick County and flows NE and S into the Atlantic Ocean through Shallotte Inlet. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733. May have been named for shallot, an onionlike plant growing in the vicinity.

label: Shallotte Sound
description: SW Brunswick County between Brantley Island on the mainland and Hales Beach running parallel to and S of the Intracoastal Waterway. Narrow and approx. 1½ mi. long.

label: Shallotte Township
description: SW Brunswick County.

label: Shallow Ford
description: community in N Alamance County served by post office, 1849-1903.

label: Shallowbag Bay
description: a bay in Roanoke Sound off the NE shore of Roanoke Island, E Dare County. The bay forms the harbor at the town of Manteo. In the late eighteenth century, it was referred to as Shalon-bas Bay (French chalonbas, "low trawl net"). Roanoke voyages-period vessel Elizabeth II, a reproduction, rests in bay.

label: Shalon-bas Bay
description: See Shallowbag Bay.

label: Shamrock
description: community in SE Mecklenburg County served by post office, 1894-1903.

label: Shanghai
description: community in SE Sampson County.

label: Shankle Mountain
description: SE Stanly County. Named for local family.

label: Shannon
description: community in N Robeson County on Big Raft Swamp served by post office since 1884.

label: Shannon Township
description: N Robeson County.

label: Shanty Cove
description: E Cherokee County on the headwaters of Seibold Branch.

label: Shanty Gap
description: in central Graham County between Mountain Creek and Sweetwater Creek.

label: Shanty Mountain
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, a spur extending NE from Balsam Mountain between Sugar Fork and Palmer Creek; centers near lat. 35°37'15" N., long. 83°09'35" W. Alt. 4,812.

label: Shanty Spring Branch
description: rises in E Avery County and flows N into Watauga County, where it enters Watauga River.

label: Shark Shoal
description: in the waters of Pamlico Sound N of Hatteras Inlet, S Dare County.

label: Sharon
description: See Iron Station.

label: Sharon Township
description: former township in S central Mecklenburg County, now township no. 4.

label: Sharp
description: community in W Rockingham County. In 1884 Thomas Sharp built gristmill and sawmill on his plantation. Area later became part of Spray, then Eden.

label: Sharp Branch
description: rises in NE Cherokee County and flows NW into Valley River.

label: Sharp Creek
description: rises in N Watauga County and flows W into Cove Creek.

label: Sharp Point
description: community in W Pitt County.

label: Sharp Top
description: mountain in central Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Noland Divide near lat. 35°28'05" N., long. 83°27'27" W. Alt. 3,430.

label: Sharper Mountain
description: W Wilkes County near the head of Cole Creek.

label: Sharpes Township
description: SE Alexander County.

label: Sharpesburg Township
description: NW Iredell County. Named for the Sharpe family.

label: Sharps
description: community in W Rockingham County. Named for John Sharp, local landowner.

label: Sharpsburg
description: town at the coincident corners of Edgecombe, Nash, and Wilson Counties. Inc. 1883. Settled about 1851. Named for John Jay Sharp, who moved there in 1844 and was later representative in the General Assembly. Alt. 143.

label: Sharptop
description: peak in S Yancey County N of Little Creek. Alt. approx. 5,500.

label: Sharptop Ridge
description: SE Clay County NW of Hightower Bald, Ga. See also Montgomery Corner.

label: Sharpy Mountain
description: N Transylvania County between Sandy Gap and Sampson Gap in Pisgah National Forest. Alt. 3,383.

label: Sharron Branch
description: rises in S central Brunswick County and flows SW into Sharron Creek.

label: Sharron Creek
description: rises in S central Brunswick County and flows SW into Shallotte River.

label: Shate Gap
description: S Yancey County near Cane River.

label: Shateen Branch
description: rises in SW Yancey County and flows E into Cane River.

label: Shatley Springs
description: community in E Ashe County.

label: Shatter Muster Ground
description: See Axtell.

label: Shaw
description: community in central Cumberland County. Alt. 227.

label: Shaw Creek
description: rises in central Henderson County and flows NW into French Broad River.

label: Shaw's Corner
description: See Shawboro.

label: Shawano Ridge
description: NE Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, extends SW from Balsam Mountain near lat. 35°40' N., long. 83°12'33" W.

label: Shawboro
description: community in W Currituck County. Settled about 1775 and first known as Bayley. Perhaps to avoid confusion with Bailey in Nash County, it was renamed Shaw's Corner after the Civil War in honor of Col. Henry Shaw, Confederate officer. Name later changed to Shawboro by the Norfolk and Southern Railroad. Alt. 15.

label: Shawnee
description: See Long Island.

label: Shawneehaw
description: See Banner Elk.

label: Shawneehaw Creek
description: rises in W Watauga County and flows SW into NE Avery County, where it enters Elk River.

label: Shawneehaw Township
description: SW Watauga County.

label: Shaws
description: community in E Scotland County.

label: Shear Knob
description: W Swain County between Yalaka Creek and a bend in Little Tennessee River.

label: Shearer Creek
description: rises in N Clay County and flows SW into Johnson Mill Creek.

label: Shearer's Hill
description: a low ridge on the N side of Yadkin River, NE Caldwell County. Named for John Shearer, who settled there about the end of the Revolution. A black cemetery there has been in use since before the Civil War, when the slaves of a number of wealthy planters in the neighborhood were interred.

label: Sheehan Creek
description: rises in NW McDowell County and flows SE into Little Buck Creek.

label: Sheep Cliffs Creek
description: rises in S Jackson County and flows N into Webb Lake.

label: Sheep Cliffs Mountain
description: between Little Sheep Cliffs and Sheep Cliffs Creek in S Jackson County. Alt. 4,681.

label: Sheep Hollow
description: S Macon County between Richey Knob and Richey Gap.

label: Sheep Island
description: in Pamlico Sound off Portsmouth Island and separated from it by Baymarsh Thorofare, E Carteret County.

label: Sheep Knob
description: S Macon County at the head of Rough Fork.

label: Sheep Knob
description: NW Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Twentymile Ridge near lat. 35°28'50" N., long. 83°49'30" W. Alt. 3,852.

label: Sheep Mountain
description: E Transylvania County between Laurel Creek and Little River.

label: Sheep Pen Gap
description: on Swain County, N.C.-Sevier County, Tenn., line in Great Smoky Mountains National Park near lat. 35°31'13" N., long. 83°52'27" W.

label: Sheep Ridge
description: SE Buncombe County in the Blue Ridge Mountains, extends N from High Top to Swannanoa River S of town of Black Mountain.

label: Sheep Rock
description: mountain in SW Buncombe County S of Browns Knob.

label: Sheep Wallow Knob
description: on the Swain County, N.C.-Blount County, Tenn., line at the NW end of Dalton Ridge.

label: Sheepback Knob
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Cataloochee Divide, near lat. 35°33'10" N., long. 83°07'33" W., between Little Bald Knob and Little Spruce Ridge. Alt. 5,520.

label: Sheepback Mountain
description: N Jackson County between Rich Mountain and Plott Balsams. Alt. 4,700.

label: Sheepwallow Knob
description: NE Buncombe County between Cedar Cliff Knob and Pigpen Knob.

label: Sheffield
description: community in NW Davie County. Named by Thomas M. Smith, postmaster, in whose store the post office was est. in 1893; service discontinued 1907.

label: Sheffields Township
description: NW Moore County.

label: Shehan
description: community in N Henderson County.

label: Shehan Crossroads
description: community in NE Polk County at the Rutherford County line.

label: Shelby
description: city and county seat in central Cleveland County. Alt. 853. Inc. 1843; charter repealed 1847. Reincorporated 1849. Named for Col. Isaac Shelby (1750-1826), Revolutionary War commander. Produces textiles, bakery products, hosiery, apparel, fiberglass, chemicals, and glass products.

label: Shelby Township
description: former township in S central Cleveland County, now township no. 6.

label: Shell Branch
description: rises in W Jackson County and flows SW into Savannah Creek.

label: Shell Castle
description: NE Carteret County, an island in Pamlico Sound between Casey Island and North Rock near the tip of Portsmouth Island at Ocracoke Inlet. Built by John Gray Blount and John Wallace in 1790 on an earlier island known as Old Rock. At one time a dwelling house, a tavern, warehouses, a lumberyard, a wharf, and a notary public's office were there. Appears on the Price map, 1808.

label: Shell Island
description: NE Carteret County in Core Sound between Wainwright Island and Core Banks. Named as early as the Moseley map, 1733. See also Hunting Quarter Sound.

label: Shell Knob
description: on the Buncombe-Henderson county line NE of Glady Fork Gap. Alt. approx. 4,020.

label: Shell Point
description: community in SW Brunswick County on E side of Shallotte River.

label: Shell Ridge
description: NE Mitchell County between Blevins Branch and Broad Branch.

label: Shell Rock Channel
description: SE Onslow County, flows S out of Bear Inlet.

label: Shell Stand Creek
description: rises in E Graham County and flows NE into Panther Creek.

label: Shellback Island
description: a tidal-marsh island in the Cape Fear River opposite Southport, SE Brunswick County.

label: Shellbank Point
description: peninsula extending from the W shore of N Bodie Island into Kitty Hawk Bay and Currituck Sound, NW Dare County. Named for mound of shells found at the site by early settlers.

label: Shelley Branch
description: rises in NW Nash County and flows SE into Sandy Creek.

label: Shelly Point
description: extends from the mainland of SW Carteret County into Bogue Sound.

label: Shelly Point
description: SE Onslow County on The Hammock, extends into White Oak River.

label: Shelmerdine
description: town in S Pitt County.

label: Shelter Mountain
description: W Montgomery County between Clark's Creek and Pee Dee River.

label: Shelter Neck
description: community in N central Pender County on the E side of Northeast Cape Fear River near DeRossett Creek.

label: Shelter River
description: See Holly Shelter Creek.

label: Shelter Swamp
description: rises in S Onslow County and flows W into Pender County, where it enters Holly Shelter Creek.

label: Shelton Branch
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows NE into Richland Creek.

label: Shelton Creek
description: rises in W Granville County and flows SE into Tar River. Appears as Charlone Creek on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Shelton Laurel
description: community in N Madison County. Alt. 1,849. Settled by Martin and David Shelton about 1790 near the junction of Shelton Laurel Creek and Big Laurel Creek. There, on January 19, 1863, 13 Union supporters (12 men and a boy) were shot by a detail of Confederate soldiers in what has become known as the Shelton Laurel Massacre. White Rock, a post office from 1851 to 1936, was in the center of the Shelton Laurel community.

label: Shelton Laurel Creek
description: rises in N Madison County and flows SW into Big Laurel Creek.

label: Shelton Laurel Township
description: former township in N Madison County, now township no. 2.

label: Shelton Town
description: community in NE Surry County between Rutledge Creek and Ararat River.

label: Shelton's Store
description: community in N Stokes County. Later known as Ziglar's Store.

label: Shepards Mill
description: community in central Stokes County on Snow Creek. A mill, still standing, operated there as early as 1819 and as recently as 1957. Snow Creek Ironworks was started there in 1770 by Col. James Martin. Limestone for ironworks at Danbury mined there.

label: Shephard Creek
description: drains Osceola Lake in central Henderson County and flows W into Mud Creek.

label: Shephard Ditch
description: NW Pasquotank County, drains NE into Pasquotank River.

label: Shepherd Bald
description: on Macon-Swain County line between Davis Bald and Leatherman Knob.

label: Shepherd Branch
description: rises in W Yancey County and flows SE into Bald Creek.

label: Shepherd Creek
description: rises in E Swain County and flows NW into Kirkland Creek.

label: Shepherd Knob
description: N Mitchell County on Shepherd Mountain.

label: Shepherd Millpond
description: on Briery Swamp in NE Pitt County.

label: Shepherd Mountain
description: W Randolph County between Little Caraway Creek and Uwharrie River. Alt. 1,390.

label: Shepherd Run
description: rises in S Greene County and flows NE into Contentnea Creek. Named for the Sheppard family, which has lived in the vicinity since the colonial period.

label: Shepherd's Branch
description: rises in W central Wilson County and flows SE into Contentnea Creek.

label: Shepherd's Point
description: a name formerly applied to the point of land on the W side of Newport River on which Morehead City now stands. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Shepherds
description: community in S Iredell County. Known as Shepherds Cross Roads in the early and middle nineteenth century.

label: Shepherdsburgh
description: See Snow Hill.

label: Sherard
description: See Cherry.

label: Sherards Crossroads
description: See Cherry.

label: Sheridan Mountains
description: E Madison County between California Creek and Bailey Branch.

label: Sherman
description: community in NW Wilkes County near the head of Middle Fork Reddies River.

label: Sherrars Gap
description: in Kings Mountain, SW Gaston County. The gap is S of The Pinnacle. See also Kings Mountain.

label: Sherrill Cove Branch
description: rises in E Swain County and flows N into Raven Fork.

label: Sherrill Gap
description: S Swain County between Rich Mountain and Will Knob.

label: Sherrill's Gap
description: See Hickory Nut Gap.

label: Sherrills Ford
description: community in SE Catawba County; known earlier as Sherrills Mill. Named for Adam Sherrill, a pioneer settler who crossed the Catawba River at Sherrills Ford, which see, a short distance E. A post office was est. there in 1842.

label: Sherrills Mill
description: See Sherrills Ford.

label: Sherrills Springs
description: community in S Cabarrus County. Mineral springs there still in use. Also known as Sossamon's Spring.

label: Sherron Acres
description: community in central Durham County approx. 1 mi. SE of the city of Durham.

label: Sherwood
description: community in W Watauga County at the junction of Vanderpool and Cove Creeks. Post office est. in 1913 as Doughton to honor Congressman Robert L. Doughton. Name changed at his request to Sherwood.

label: Sheva
description: community in NW Mecklenburg County served by post office, 1892-1903.

label: Shewbird Mountain
description: S Clay County near the SW end of Cherry Mountain.

label: Shields
description: community in SW Cherokee County.

label: Shields Ridge
description: N Yancey County between Charlie Creek and Cove Branch.

label: Shiloh
description: community in SW Rutherford County near the headwaters of Jarretts Creek.

label: Shiloh Mills
description: community in E Edgecombe County.

label: Shiloh Township
description: SE Iredell County. Named for Shiloh Presbyterian Church, near its center.

label: Shinbone Creek
description: rises in NW Mitchell County and flows SE into Hollow Poplar Creek.

label: Shinbone Ridge
description: N Clay County between Fires Creek and Long Branch.

label: Shinbone Ridge
description: N Madison County between Wolf Branch and Orchard Ridge.

label: Shine
description: See Rufe.

label: Shine Township
description: W central Greene County. Named for the Shine family. See also Rufe.

label: Shines Crossroads
description: community in W Greene County. See also Rufe.

label: Shingle Cove
description: S Haywood County on Richland Creek.

label: Shingle Creek
description: a tidal creek in the waters of Pamlico Sound on N Ocracoke Island, SE Hyde County.

label: Shingle Hollow
description: community in W central Rutherford County S of Toms Mountain. Post office serving the community, 1897-1906, was named Nanito.

label: Shingle Landing Creek
description: rises in Norfolk County, Va., and flows SE through NW Currituck County and into Northwest River. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733, and others as recent as MacRae, 1833, as Moyock Creek. Apparently named Shingle Landing about 1800.

label: Shingle Pile Creek
description: rises in E Yancey County and flows W into Little Whiteoak Creek.

label: Shingle Point
description: the W side of an unnamed island off Core Banks in Core Sound, E Carteret County. The island is between Goose Island on the S and Duges Island on the n.

label: Shingle Top
description: S Cherokee County between Cane, Martin, and Moccasin Creeks.

label: Shingletree Branch
description: rises in central Macon County and flows S into Wayah Creek.

label: Shingletree Swamp
description: rises in SW Brunswick County and flows NW into Cawcaw Swamp on W edge of Thomas Bay.

label: Shining Creek
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows E into East Fork Pigeon River.

label: Shining Creek Gap
description: SE Haywood County on the mouth of Shining Creek.

label: Shining Rock Creek
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows W into Little East Fork Pigeon River.

label: Shining Rock Gap
description: S Haywood County on the head of North Fork.

label: Shining Rock Ledge
description: S Haywood County, extends N from Black Balsam Knob to Cold Mountain.

label: Shining Rock Mountain
description: S Haywood County between Shining Rock Gap and Buck Spring Gap. Alt. 5,940.

label: Shinnsville
description: community in SE Iredell County.

label: Shinnville
description: See Georgeville.

label: Shiny Creek
description: rises in S Haywood County E of Spruce Ridge and flows N and then NW into Allen Creek.

label: Ship Channel
description: See Blair Channel.

label: Ship Point
description: N Tyrrell County, extends from the mainland into Albemarle Sound.

label: Shipyard
description: community on the Pasquotank River in W Camden County. In the eighteenth century, the area was a center for the construction of small commercial sailing vessels. The river there is straight and narrow for more than a mi., and it is now a popular spot for motorboat races.

label: Shit-Britches Creek
description: rises in SE Buncombe County on Burney Mountain and flows NW into Cane Creek. Named by early settlers who saw an Indian washing himself in the stream after an "accident" in his britches. The name appears frequently in early deeds but also is called Dirty Britches Creek.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in S Cleveland County and flows W into First Broad River.

label: Shoal Creek
description: rises in E Yancey County and flows S into Little Crabtree Creek.

label: Shoal Creek Falls
description: on Shoal Creek in SW Henderson County.

label: Shoal Creek Gap
description: E Yancey County near the head of Shoal Creek.

label: Shoal Creek Township
description: W central Cherokee County.

label: Shoal Inlet
description: See Masonboro Inlet.

label: Shoal Mountain
description: NE Rutherford County near the head of Hardbargain Branch. Alt. 2,340.

label: Shoals
description: community in SE Surry County between Grassy Creek and Yadkin River. Named for Bean Shoals in Yadkin River.

label: Shoals Township
description: SE Surry County.

label: Shocco
description: community in N Franklin County. Site of popular nineteenth-century springs and resort.

label: Shocco Creek
description: rises in E Vance County and flows SE through Warren County onto the Franklin-Warren County line, where it enters Fishing Creek. Shown on the Price map, 1808. Named for the Shoccoree Indian tribe.

label: Shocco Springs
description: former health resort in S Warren County on Shocco Creek. Located approx. 9 mi. S of Warrenton, it was popular in the nineteenth century as a social, recreational, and health resort built around mineral springs. Shocco Male Academy was located there. Neither is in existence any longer. Shocco Springs had a post office from 1832 until 1866 and was shown on the Price map, 1808.

label: Shocco Township
description: S Warren County.

label: Shoe
description: community in W Wilkes County between North Prong Lewis Fork Creek and South Fork Reddies River.

label: Shoe Branch
description: rises in N central Carteret County and flows S into Newport River.

label: Shoe Heel
description: See Maxton.

label: Shoeheel Creek
description: rises in E Scotland County and flows S into Big Shoeheel Creek. See also Maxton.

label: Sholars Crossroads
description: community in S Duplin County.

label: Shole Inlet
description: See Masonboro Inlet.

label: Sholes of Hatteras
description: See Diamond Shoals.

label: Shoofly
description: See Maribel.

label: Shook Branch
description: rises in E central Madison County and flows W into Big Laurel Creek.

label: Shook Brook
description: rises in S Catawba County and flows SE into Rhodes Mill Creek.

label: Shook Gap
description: central Haywood County between Colman Gap and Cansadie Top. Alt. 2,800.

label: Shookville
description: community on Little Buck Creek in E Macon County.

label: Shooting Creek
description: community in S Clay County on Shooting Creek.

label: Shooting Creek Bald
description: S central Clay County. Alt. 5,010.

label: Shooting Creek Township
description: E Clay County.

label: Shooting Ridge
description: N Transylvania County, extends NE from Funneltop Mountain to Bradley Creek.

label: Shop Branch
description: rises in W Mitchell County and flows NW into Nolichucky River.

label: Shop Cove
description: on the Beaufort-Pitt County line at the confluence of Tar River and Tranters Creek.

label: Shop Creek
description: rises in W Macon County and flows S into Little Choga Creek.

label: Shope Branch
description: rises in S Macon County and flows SE into North Fork [Skennah Creek].

label: Shope Cove
description: N Macon County on a tributary of Burningtown Creek.

label: Shope Creek
description: rises in N Buncombe County and flows SE into Bull Creek.

label: Shope Fork
description: rises in S Macon County and flows NE into Coweeta Creek.

label: Shope Knob
description: S Swain County between Cullasaja Branch and Jones Creek.

label: Shopton
description: community in SW Mecklenburg County on the head of Steele Creek. Around 1880 J. R. Hays started a general store there. By 1890 several shops operated there, and the area became known as Shop Town or Shopton.

label: Shore
description: See Flint Hill.

label: Shore Ridge Mountain
description: NE Rutherford County between Lump and Chalk Mountains.

label: Short Bunk
description: ridge in W Haywood County between Conrad Branch and Coggins Branch.

label: Short Creek
description: rises in SE Beaufort County and flows N into South Creek.

label: Short Off
description: community in SE Macon County near the mountain of the same name. Served by post office, 1880-1920.

label: Short Swamp Branch
description: rises in NW Nash County and flows S into Sandy Creek.

label: Shortoff Gap
description: on the Jackson-Macon County line.

label: Shortoff Mountain
description: on the Jackson-Macon County line. Alt. 5,054.

label: Shorty Top
description: central Cherokee County near the headwaters of Dockery and Rose Creeks.

label: Shot Beech Ridge
description: N Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park extending S from Thomas Ridge near lat. 35°35' N., long. 83°25' W.

label: Shot Pouch Creek
description: rises in W Macon County and flows SE into Wayah Creek.

label: Shot Pouch Knob
description: on the Jackson-Haywood County line.

label: Shotwell
description: community in E Wake County between Marks and Poplar Creeks. Served by post office, 1883-1900. Named for Randolph Abbott Shotwell (1844-85), Confederate soldier and Democratic editor in Rutherford County.

label: Shoups Ford
description: in S Burke County crosses Jacob Fork.

label: Shuck Ridge Creek
description: rises in NW Transylvania County and flows SE into Daniel Ridge Creek.

label: Shuckpen Gap
description: on the Buncombe-Haywood County line between Doubletop Mountain and Thompson Knob.

label: Shuckstack Mountain
description: W Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Twentymile Ridge near lat. 35°29'08" N., long. 83°48'55" W. Alt. 4,100.

label: Shuckstack Ridge
description: NW Swain County, extends SE from Shuckstack Mountain to Fontana Lake.

label: Shuford Creek
description: rises in E Yancey County and flows SE into Whiteoak Creek.

label: Shuford Mountain
description: E Transylvania County near the head of McCall Branch.

label: Shufordsville
description: See Arden.

label: Shugan Creek
description: See Little Sugar Creek.

label: Shular Gap
description: S Swain County N of Little Yalaka Creek.

label: Shuler Creek
description: rises in NW Cherokee County and flows SW into Hiwassee River on the Polk County, Tenn., line.

label: Shuler Mountain
description: SW Cherokee County near the headwaters of Dickey Branch.

label: Shulls Mill
description: community in S Watauga County on Watauga River. Est. as a post office in 1870 (closed 1955); named for Joseph Shulls, settler, whose daughter eloped with the local sheriff, Cobb McCandless. The couple went to the West, where McCandless joined the Jesse James gang and was killed by a member of the Jones gang, a rival group.

label: Shumaker Mountain
description: See Fox's Mountain.

label: Shumont
description: community in SE Buncombe County.

label: Shumont Mountain
description: on the Buncombe-Rutherford County line approx. 2 mi. N of Chimney Rock. Alt. approx. 3,839. Formerly known also as Harris Mountain and Leaventhorps View.

label: Shunkawakan Falls
description: on Whiteoak Creek, central Polk County. Water originally fell for a total of 500 ft., but blasting for road construction broke the falls into two sections.

label: Shut-in Creek
description: is formed in W Madison County by the junction of West Fork Shut-in Creek and East Fork Shut-in Creek and flows NE into French Broad River.

label: Shut-in Ridge
description: S Buncombe County between Bent Creek and French Broad River.

label: Shute
description: community in central Union County NW of the city of Monroe.

label: Shute Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows SE into North Fork [Swannanoa River].

label: Shutin Branch
description: rises in N central Transylvania County and flows NE into Davidson River.

label: Shutin Ridge
description: N central Transylvania County, extends E along the course of Joel Branch.

label: Sid Hill
description: N Yancey County between Peterson Branch and Whitson Branch.

label: Sidney
description: town in SW Columbus County. Inc. 1881, but long inactive in municipal affairs.

label: Sigmonsburg
description: See Glen Alpine.

label: Signal Bald
description: peak on the Clay-Macon County line. Alt. 5,275.

label: Signal Pole Hill
description: SW Cherokee County on SE end of Pack Mountain. Alt. 3,459.

label: Sikes Branch
description: rises in W Carteret County and flows approx. 2 mi. S and E to join East Prong in forming Sanders Creek.

label: Silas Creek
description: community in N Ashe County. Alt. approx. 2,740.

label: Siler Bald
description: SW Macon County at the head of Roaring Fork Creek approx. 1 mi. S of Wayah Gap. Alt. 5,216. Part of Nantahala Mountain Range. Named for Jesse Richardson Siler, pioneer settler in the area. See also Silers Bald.

label: Siler Bald Branch
description: rises on the S side of Siler Bald in SW Macon County and flows SE into Bryson Branch.

label: Siler City
description: town in W Chatham County. Known first as Matthews Cross Roads because it was at the junction of the Raleigh-Salisbury and Fayetteville-Greensboro plank roads. Later known as Siler's Store and Siler's Station. Post office est. there in 1880 as Energy; changed to Siler City in 1884. Inc. 1887. Alt. 598. Produces furniture, textiles, processed grain, and poultry.

label: Silers Bald
description: mountain on the Swain County, N.C.-Sevier County, Tenn., line in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Welch Ridge near lat. 35°33'58" N., long. 83°33'56" W. Alt. 5,620. Named for Jesse Richardson Siler (1793-1876) of Franklin, who owned the mountain and kept large herds of cattle on it.

label: Siles Branch
description: rises in W Swain County and flows NW into Nantahala River.

label: Siles Gap
description: S Swain County between the head of Tarkiln Branch and the head of Siles Branch.

label: Silk Hope
description: community in NW Chatham County. Probably named in antebellum period at a time when there was an interest in producing homegrown silk.

label: Sills Creek
description: rises in W Rowan County and flows NE into Back Creek. Named for John Sill, who settled there in 1749.

label: Siloam
description: community in S Surry County on Yadkin River. Alt. 811. Halls Ferry across the river was operated there as late as the 1930s.

label: Siloam Township
description: SE Surry County.

label: Silver
description: community in SE Stanly County served by post office, 1884-1906. Later known as Rocky River Springs.

label: Silver Bluff
description: community in S Haywood County on Pigeon River.

label: Silver City
description: community in central Hoke County N of town of Raeford.

label: Silver Creek
description: rises in N Transylvania County and flows SE into Turkey Creek.

label: Silver Creek Gap
description: in N Transylvania County on Sitton Mountain.

label: Silver Creek Knob
description: on the Burke-Rutherford county line. Alt. 2,838.

label: Silver Creek Township
description: SW Burke County.

label: Silver Hill
description: community in N Scotland County near Monroes Millpond.

label: Silver Hill Pocosin
description: a muck-filled area approx. 4 mi. by 4½ mi. in NW Pamlico County.

label: Silver Hill Township
description: central Davidson County.

label: Silver Knob
description: NW McDowell County near Limekiln Creek.

label: Silver Lake
description: NW Wilson County on Toisnot Swamp. Covers 175 acres; max. depth 12 ft. Fishing, swimming, boating, and municipal water supply. Formed in 1785 by John Dew and known as Dew's Mill until about 1847. Called by the name of various owners until about 1922, when present name was applied.

label: Silver Run
description: rises in E Cumberland County and flows NW into Cape Fear River.

label: Silver Run
description: rises in S Mitchell County and flows E into Grassy Creek.

label: Silver Run Creek
description: rises in W Randolph County and flows SW into Uwharrie River.

label: Silver Run Falls
description: in Cape Fear River at its junction with Silver Run approx. 3 mi. S of the mouth of Little River, NE Cumberland County. A series of small falls or rapids drop approx. 5 ft. in 300 yards. Mentioned in Fulton's survey of North Carolina rivers in 1819 and appears on the MacRae map, 1833.

label: Silver Springs
description: community in central Gates County on the S side of Merchants Millpond. Named for an artesian spring. Formerly a popular spot for picnics.

label: Silver Town
description: community in SW Brunswick County.

label: Silver Valley
description: community in E Davidson County.

label: Silverboro
description: See Boyette.

label: Silverdale
description: community in E Onslow County between Freemans Creek and Webb Creek.

label: Silvermine Bald
description: on the Haywood-Transylvania county line NE of Chestnut Bald.

label: Silvermine Branch
description: rises in central Swain County and flows SW into Lands Creek.

label: Silvermine Creek
description: rises in SW Swain County and flows NE into Nantahala River.

label: Silvermine Gap
description: SW Swain County on the head of Silvermine Creek.

label: Silvers Cove
description: E Haywood County on the head of Silvers Cove Creek.

label: Silvers Cove Creek
description: rises in E Haywood County in Silvers Cove and flows SW into Rush Fork.

label: Silverstone
description: community in N Watauga County on Sharp Creek.

label: Sim
description: community in E Robeson County served by post office, 1888-1903.

label: Simes Creek
description: See Perry Creek.

label: Simmon Grove
description: community in N Chatham County served by post office, 1861-1904.

label: Simmons Branch
description: rises in W Wilkes County and flows E into Dugger Creek.

label: Simmons Cove
description: N Buncombe County W of Paint Fork community.

label: Simmons Knob
description: E Yancey County between the head of Mine Branch and Crabtree Creek.

label: Simmons Landing
description: NW Tyrrell County on Scuppernong River.

label: Simmons Ridge
description: SE Avery County.

label: Simms Fork
description: rises in W Yancey County and flows S into Elk Wallow Creek.

label: Simon Branch
description: rises in central Cherokee County and flows SE into Morgan Creek.

label: Simon Branch
description: rises in N Macon County and flows SW into Little Tennessee River.

label: Simpson
description: town in E Pitt County. Inc. 1923; post office est. 1888 as Chicod. Name changed in 1960. Alt. 63.

label: Simpson Branch
description: rises in SW Union County and flows S into South Carolina, where it enters Cane Creek.

label: Simpsons Store
description: community in W Rockingham County served by post office, 1879-1902, which operated in Patrick Simpson's store.

label: Simpsonville Township
description: S Rockingham County.

label: Sims
description: town in NW Wilson County, was settled before 1908, when a post office was est. Inc. 1913 as Simms; named for W. W. Simms. Reincorporated in 1923 as Sims. A large stone quarry is nearby.

label: Sims Creek
description: rises in S Watauga County and flows SW into Boone Fork.

label: Sincerity
description: community in NE Union County on Richardson Creek.

label: Singecat Ridge
description: NW McDowell County near the head of Buck Creek.

label: Singletary Lake
description: E Bladen County, a 572-acre natural lake with a max. depth of 11 ft., 8 in. Named for Richard Singletary, who received a grant of land in Bladen County in 1729. Part of Singletary Lake State Park. Fishing, boating, swimming, and camping. See also Carolina Bays.

label: Singleton Swamp
description: rises in NW Beaufort County and flows NW and W into Old Ford Swamp.

label: Singletons Bay
description: loam-filled bay in SE Hoke County between Big Marsh Swamp and Little Marsh Swamp.

label: Sings Creek
description: rises in W Moore County and flows NE into Wet Creek.

label: Sinking Creek
description: rises in NW Haywood County and flows NE into Big Creek.

label: Sioux
description: community in N Yancey County on Big Creek. Served by post office, 1887-1955. Alt. 2,109.

label: Sippanaw
description: See Rudd.

label: Sippihaw
description: community in S Wake County served by post office, 1900-1902.

label: Sites
description: community in S Bladen County in Carvers Creek Township served by post office, 1902-17.

label: Sitting Bear Mountain
description: NW Burke County. Alt. approx. 4,100.

label: Sitton
description: community in NW Henderson County on South Fork. Served by post office, 1888-1904, named for postmaster Silas Sitton.

label: Sitton Creek
description: rises in N Transylvania County and flows SE into Boylston Creek.

label: Sitton Knob
description: N Transylvania County at the SE end of Sitton Mountain.

label: Sitton Mountain
description: N Transylvania County, extends SE between North Prong Turkey Creek and Sitton Creek.

label: Six Forks
description: community in N Wake County near the head of Mine Creek where six roads come together; formerly called Tippers Crossroads.

label: Six Runs
description: community in E Sampson County.

label: Six Runs Creek
description: rises in NE Sampson County and flows S and SW to join Coharie River in forming Black River. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Sixmile Creek
description: rises in SE Mecklenburg County and flows SW on the Mecklenburg-Union county line into South Carolina, where it enters Sugar Creek.

label: Sixpound Creek
description: rises in N central Warren County and flows N then NE into Lake Gaston. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733.

label: Sixpound Township
description: N Warren County.

label: Skalley Branch
description: rises in N Avery County and flows W into Elk River.

label: Skalley Knob
description: N Avery County.

label: Skeenah Creek
description: is formed in S Macon County by the junction of North Fork [Skeenah Creek] and South Fork [Skeenah Creek] and flows E into Little Tennessee River. The name is said to be an Indian word meaning "the abode of satan."

label: Skeenah Gap
description: S Macon County between Black Mountain Branch and Jones Creek.

label: Skewarky
description: See Williamston.

label: Skibo
description: or Skibow (Sky-bow), community in central Cumberland County. Alt. 221.

label: Skidder Branch
description: rises in NE Swain County and flows SE into Straight Fork.

label: Skiffley Creek
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SE into Pigeon River.

label: Skiffly Branch
description: rises in W Madison County and flows S into Roaring Fork.

label: Skin Cabin Creek
description: rises in S Surry County and flows SE into Ararat River.

label: Skinner Canal
description: N Washington County, drains N from East Dismal Swamp to Kendricks Creek. Known in 1868 as McRae Canal.

label: Skinner's Point
description: See Hornblower Point.

label: Skinnersville
description: community in N Washington County. Post office est. in 1808 with service until 1908. Name was changed to Leo. The site of the community having moved to the ne, the old site became known locally as Old Skinnersville.

label: Skinnersville Township
description: NE Washington County, was formed in 1868.

label: Skipper Branch
description: rises in S central Brunswick County and flows S into Shallotte Creek.

label: Skitty Creek
description: rises in E Macon County and flows S into Cullasaja River.

label: Skull Camp Mountain
description: NW Surry County. Alt. 2,082. A post office, Scull Camp, served the area, 1800-1856. The name appears on the U.S. Coast Survey map, 1865.

label: Skunk Creek
description: rises in central Lee County and flows NW into Big Buffalo Creek.

label: Sky View Pond
description: spring-fed lake in NE Iredell County. Formed in 1950; covers 38 acres, with a max. depth of 35 ft. Fishing, swimming, boating.

label: Skyco
description: former community and steamboat landing on the SW shore of Roanoke Island, E Dare County. It was on Ashby Harbor. Named for Skiko, son of the chief of the Choanoke Indians, who was taken prisoner by Ralph Lane in 1586. Skyco was a post office from 1892 until 1913.

label: Skyland
description: community in S Buncombe County. Alt. 2,257. Est. 1888 by Otis A. Miller as a resort. Produces electronic components.

label: Skyland Lake
description: S Buncombe County on Powell Creek, was formed in 1963 by Carolina Power and Light Company with the construction of an E dam and concrete spillway. It covers 320 acres, with a max. depth of 100 ft. and a shoreline of 9 mi. Used to condense turbine-exhaust steam at a steam power-generating plant and for public recreation.

label: Skyuka Creek
description: rises in S Polk County E of Tryon Mountain and flows S into Pacolet River. Named for the Cherokee brave who, about 1774, showed his friendship for the whites by revealing to them an unknown route through the mountains. Knowledge of the route enabled Capt. Thomas Howard to defeat the Indians at Round Mountain, which see.

label: Skyuka Mountain
description: SW Polk County rising above the town of Tryon. Said to be named for Skyuka, son of a Cherokee chief. Skyuka was thrown from his horse and broke his leg when the horse became frightened by a snake. Capt. Thomas Howard found Skyuka and set his leg, and the two became friends. See also Howard Gap.

label: Slab Camp Branch
description: rises in N Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park and flows E into Forney Creek.

label: Slab Ridge
description: See Sharon.

label: Slab Town
description: See Grissom.

label: Slade Creek
description: See Blounts Creek.

label: Slades Swamp
description: rises in S Bladen County and flows NW along the Bladen-Columbus county line into Brown Marsh Swamp.

label: Sladesville
description: town in SW Hyde County on Slade Creek. Inc. 1849, but long inactive in municipal affairs.

label: Slap Swamp
description: rises in N Columbus County and flows SE into Friar Swamp.

label: Slashes, The
description: a large marsh approx. 4 mi. wide in E Halifax County between Conoconnara Swamp and Roanoke River.

label: Slate
description: community in W Stokes County served by post office, 1884-1905.

label: Slate Creek
description: rises in NW Cherokee County and flows SE into Shuler Creek.

label: Slate Mountain
description: NE Surry County between Ararat River and Archies Creek.

label: Slate Rock Creek
description: rises between Laurel Mountain and Slate Rock Ridge in W Transylvania County and flows SE into Henderson County, where it enters Bradley Creek in Pisgah National Forest.

label: Slate Rock Ridge
description: N Transylvania County, extends SE from the NW end of Dividing Ridge to the NW end of Pilot Cove.

label: Slatestone
description: community in N central Beaufort County. Alt. 40.

label: Slatten Creek
description: rises in central Jackson County and flows SE into Robinson Creek.

label: Slaty Branch
description: rises in NE Buncombe County and flows SE into Flat Creek.

label: Slaty Knob
description: W Madison County between Rector Branch and French Broad River. Alt. 2,790.

label: Sled Runner Gap
description: in the Unicoi Mountains on the Cherokee County, N.C.-Monroe County, Tenn., line near the headwaters of Garreck Creek. Alt. approx. 3,850.

label: Sleepy Creek
description: rises in S Wayne County and flows NE into Neuse River. Saponi Indians lived along its banks, and many arrowheads and artifacts have been found there. Tradition says that the Indians believed the waters of the creek had medicinal values. Sick Indians came to drink the water and later would lie along the creek banks to sleep, hence the name.

label: Sleepy Gap
description: S Buncombe County between Grassy Knob and Truckwheel Mountain.

label: Slek Creek
description: See Town Fork Creek.

label: Slick Rock
description: elevation in S Macon County between Stephens Creek and Gold Mine Branch. Alt. approx. 3,860.

label: Slick Rock Falls
description: N Transylvania County in a branch of Rockhouse Creek.

label: Slick Rock Mountain
description: W Randolph County W of Caraway Mountain and in close proximity to Black Jack, Vineyard, and Prickly Pear Mountains.

label: Slickens Creek
description: rises in E Jackson County and flows NE into Tuckasegee River.

label: Slicking Gap
description: on the Transylvania County, N.C.-Greenville County, S.C., line in the Blue Ridge Mountains near the head of Bursted Rock Creek. Sometimes known as Slick Gap or Slicken Gap. Alt. 2,873.

label: Slickrock Branch
description: rises in NE Henderson County approx. 2 mi. SW of Bat Cave community and flows approx. 1 mi. SE into Reedy Patch Creek. Named for the appearance of rocks in the stream.

label: Slickrock Creek
description: rises in NW Graham County and flows NE to the Graham County, N.C.-Monroe County, Tenn., line, which it follows into Little Tennessee River.

label: Slickrock Knob
description: W Yancey County at the S end of Sampson Mountain.

label: Slickrock Mountain
description: W central Yancey County between Phipps and Baker Creeks.

label: Slide Branch
description: rises in NW Haywood County and flows N into Big Creek.

label: Sliding Knob Creek
description: rises in SW Madison County and flows W into Spring Creek.

label: Sligo
description: community in N Currituck County on the W side of Tull Creek. Served by post office, 1854-1910. Named by a Methodist circuit rider from Sligo, Ireland, who visited the area in 1783. Also known as Cowell's Bridge.

label: Slim Creek
description: rises in N McDowell County on the W slope of Betsy Ridge and flows S into Little Buck Creek.

label: Slipoff Branch
description: rises in E Swain County and flows NE into Connelly Creek.

label: Slipoff Knob
description: E Swain County between the head of Connelly Creek and the head of Slipoff Branch.

label: Slippery Hill Ridge
description: W Avery County.

label: Sloan
description: or See Stony Point.

label: Sloan's Crossing
description: See Garland.

label: Sloans Creek
description: rises in W Rowan County and flows N approx. 3 mi. into Kerr Creek, which see. Known first as South Fork of James Cathey's Mill Creek and later as Marlins Creek.

label: Slocomb
description: community in N Cumberland County.

label: Slocomb Crossroads
description: See Turlington.

label: Slocum Creek
description: rises in SE Craven County and flows N into Neuse River. Appears on the Moseley map, 1733, as Slocumbs Creek.

label: Sloop Point
description: extends from the mainland of S Pender County into Virginia Creek estuary in Topsail Sound. Named for the fact that sloops entering the sound moored there. Sloop Point post office, 1879-1936, was located at what is now Barlowes, which see. Site of oldest house in North Carolina, "Sloop Point" (ca. 1726).

label: Slosh
description: See Schlosstown.

label: Slough, The
description: stream, rises in N Wayne County and flows E into Nahunta Swamp.

label: Slow Creek
description: rises in E Cherokee County and flows SW into Peachtree Creek.

label: Sluder Branch
description: rises in NW Buncombe County on E slopes of Hanlon Mountain and flows NE and then SE into Newfound Creek.

label: Sluice Gap
description: on the Swain County, N.C.-Sevier County, Tenn., line between Mount Kephart and The Sawteeth.

label: Sly
description: community in W Ashe County.

label: Small
description: community in S central Beaufort County.

label: Smallwood Island
description: a silty clay-loam island approx. 1¼ mi. long in Roanoke River, W Northampton County.

label: Smart Branch
description: rises in S Macon County and flows SW into Middle Creek.

label: Smathers View Mountain
description: extends E from Thompson Knob, which see, to Peggy Peak in SW Buncombe County.

label: Smethport
description: community in central Ashe County. Named for the town in Pennsylvania from which a local tanning extract plant had moved.

label: Smileys Falls
description: S Harnett County in Cape Fear River at the mouth of Upper Little River. A succession of ledges of rock there drops the water from 6 to 18 inches in most cases, but there is one fall of 4 ft. and another of 5 ft. Mentioned in Fulton's survey of North Carolina rivers in 1819.

label: Smith
description: community in N Forsyth County served by post office, 1883-1925.

label: Smith Branch
description: rises in SE Mitchell County and flows N into Rose Creek.

label: Smith Branch
description: rises in N Swain County and flows SW into Oconaluftee River.

label: Smith Creek
description: rises in W Warren County and flows NE into Mecklenburg County, Va., where it enters Roanoke River. Shown on the Moseley map, 1733, as Great Creek but appears by the present name on the Price map, 1808.

label: Smith Creek Township
description: NW Warren County.

label: Smith Gap
description: E Haywood County between Big Branch and Crabtree Creek.

label: Smith Grove
description: community in central Davie County approx. 6 mi. NE of town of Mocksville. Named for a Methodist campground est. there in 1826. Post office est. 1834. Alt. 824.

label: Smith Island
description: SE Brunswick County at the mouth of Cape Fear River and bounded on the N by Corncake Inlet. Also known as Bald Head Island. The SE tip is Cape Fear, and the SW portion is known as Bald Head because of its round, sandy surface. The island is approx. 17,000 acres in area and contains palmetto trees and other interesting vegetation and wildlife. Named for Landgrave Thomas Smith, who acquired it in 1690. Appears as Landgrave Thomas Smith's Island on the Moseley map, 1733, on which the present Bald Head is marked Barren Head. The Collet map, 1770, shows only "Bald Head." When Thomas Smith willed the island to his four sons in 1738, he said that its old name was Cedar Island. Scene of World War II training as auxiliary site of Camp Davis. Island developed in 1974. Access by ferry; no state-maintained roads or motorized traffic.

label: Smith Mill Creek
description: rises in central Buncombe County near Deaver View Mountain and flows W through the city of Asheville into French Broad River.

label: Smith Millpond
description: S Wayne County on Sleepy Creek.

label: Smith Mountain
description: E Burke County. Alt. approx. 2,000.

label: Smith River
description: rises in W Virginia and flows NE to a point approx. 3 mi. N of the North Carolina-Virginia state line, where it turns S and flows SE into N Rockingham County. It enters Dan River at Eden. Called Irvin River by William Byrd in 1728 and appears as Irvine River on the Moseley map, 1733. Named for Alexander Irvine, professor of mathematics at the College of William and Mary and a member of Byrd's survey party of the North Carolina-Virginia line. Over time came to be known as Smith River for hunters Gideon and Daniel Smith, who settled on the upper waters of the river. Appears as Smith River on the Price map, 1808.

label: Smith Township
description: E central Duplin County.

label: Smith Walker Mountain
description: SW Wilkes County between Warrior and Beaver Creeks. Named for a nineteenth-century resident of the area.

label: Smith's Corner
description: community in S central Camden County. Named for a physician who practiced there about 1840-70. Alt. 10.

label: Smith's Creek
description: See Sanders Creek.

label: Smith's Ferry
description: See Hinton's Quarter.

label: Smith's Point
description: See Mauls Point.

label: Smith's Store
description: See Albemarle.

label: Smitheys Creek
description: rises in W Wilkes County and flows S into W. Kerr Scott Reservoir. Prior to 1962 the spelling was Smithies Creek.

label: Smithfield
description: town and county seat, central Johnston County on Neuse River. County court first held at the site in August 1771, when it became the county seat. Known as Johnston Court House until 1777, when it was est. as Smithfield. Named for John Smith, owner of land on which the town developed. The legislature met there in 1779. Produces textiles, apparel, lumber, electronic components, and processed meat. Alt. 155. See also Hinton's Quarter. Home of Ava Gardner Museum.

label: Smithfield Township
description: central Johnston County.

label: Smithies Creek
description: See Smitheys Creek.

label: Smiths
description: community in S central Brunswick County.

label: Smiths Bridge Township
description: SW Macon County.

label: Smiths Corner
description: See Smyrna.

label: Smiths Creek
description: rises in NE Wake County and flows SW into Neuse River.

label: Smiths Mill Creek
description: See Mill Creek.

label: Smiths Mill Pond
description: E Robeson County on Oak Swamp. Covers 50 acres; max. depth 8 ft.

label: Smiths Pond
description: an artificial pond in NE Bladen County built about 1883. Max. depth approx. 10 ft. Fishing.

label: Smiths Store
description: community in E Alexander County.

label: Smiths Store
description: community in S Lincoln County.

label: Smiths Township
description: W Robeson County.

label: Smithtown
description: town in N Yadkin County, inc. 1924 and named for Columbus Smith, who settled there about 1894 to operate a cabinet shop and small furniture factory. Post office named Poindexter served the community, 1885-1907. No longer active in municipal affairs.

label: Smithville
description: See Southport.

label: Smithville Township
description: S Brunswick County.

label: Smithwick
description: community in S Martin County on Long Creek.

label: Smithwick Creek
description: rises in S Martin County and flows N into Statons Pond on Sweetwater Creek.

label: Smokemont
description: community in NE Swain County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park on Oconaluftee River. Alt. 2,188.

label: Smokey Gap
description: N central Avery County.

label: Smoky
description: See Bald Mountains.

label: Smoky Cove
description: S Haywood County on Dix Creek.

label: Smoky Creek
description: rises in S Caldwell County and flows S into N Burke County, where it enters Catawba River.

label: Smoky Creek Township
description: N central Burke County.

label: Smoky Dome
description: See Clingmans Dome.

label: Smoky Mountain
description: SE Henderson County between Butler and Blake Mountains.

label: Smoky Mountains
description: See Great Smoky Mountains.

label: Smyre Creek
description: rises in central Catawba County and flows W and then S into Clark Creek.

label: Smyre Mills
description: See Ranlo-Rex-Priscilla.

label: Smyrna
description: community in E Carteret County on Middens Creek. First called Wit and later Smiths Corner. Post office est. 1853.

label: Smyrna Creek
description: rises in E Carteret County and flows SE into Jarrett Bay.

label: Smyrna Township
description: SE Robeson County.

label: Smyth
description: See Balfour.

label: Snaggy Bald
description: E Jackson County between Thunder Struck Mountain and Deep Gap. Alt. 5,538.

label: Snaggy Point
description: peak in W Madison County between Hogback Mountain and Meadow Fork.

label: Snaggy Ridge
description: S Haywood County between Cold Spring Branch and Deep Gap Branch.

label: Snake Bite Township
description: central Bertie County.

label: Snake Branch
description: rises in W Haywood County and flows NW into Caldwell Fork.

label: Snake Branch
description: rises in S Hertford County and flows NE into Ahoskie Swamp.

label: Snake Den Mountain
description: NE Madison County between Little Foster Creek and Foster Creek.

label: Snake Island
description: a long, narrow, tidal-marsh island in SW Carteret County in Bogue Sound.

label: Snake Knob
description: See Inadu Knob.

label: Snake Mountain
description: N Watauga County, extends N from Rich Mountain. Alt. 5,574.

label: Snake Ridge
description: W Haywood County in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, a short spur extending NW from Cataloochee Divide; center near lat. 35°36'10" N., 83°04'54" W.

label: Snakeden Knob
description: S Macon County between Dryman Fork and Ball Creek.

label: Snakeden Mountain
description: S central Avery County.

label: Snakeden Ridge
description: W Swain County, extends SE between Birchfield Branch and Lost Cove Creek from Shuckstack Mountain to Eagle Creek.

label: Snakeden Top
description: central Haywood County on the E end of Goatrock Ridge.

label: Snapp
description: community in W Gaston County served by post office, 1883-1902.

label: Snatchet
description: community in E Duplin County later known as Beulaville, which see.

label: Snead Branch
description: rises in E Cherokee County and flows SE into Slow Creek.

label: Sneads Creek
description: rises in S Onslow County and flows SE into New River.

label: Sneads Ferry
description: community in S Onslow County on New River. Alt. 10. Originally called Lower Ferry on New River when the first ferry was licensed and operated there by Edmund Ennett in 1725. Robert W. Snead settled there about 1760 and operated the ferry and a tavern. The name of the community was then changed to Sneads Ferry. Post office est. 1842. The ferry ceased to operate in 1939 when a bridge was opened a short distance up the river. Appears on the Collet map, 1770. See also Fulcher Landing.

label: Sneads Grove
description: community in central Scotland County. Known earlier as Sneads Grove Church.

label: Sneed Branch
description: rises in central Cherokee County and flows SW parallel to Rocky Pen Ridge into Nottely River.

label: Sneedsborough
description: See Old Sneedsborough.

label: Sneeky Creek
description: rose in S Clay County and flowed NE into Hiwassee River. Its course is now covered by the waters of Chatuge Lake.

label: Snider
description: community in S Davidson County.

label: Snipe Creek
description: rises in W Person County and flows NW into Mill Creek.

label: Snoad Branch
description: rises in NW Beaufort County and flows SE to join Old Ford Swamp in forming Aggie Run.

label: Snodes Creek
description: rises in SE Beaufort County and flows E into Goose Creek.

label: Snow Camp
description: community in SW Alamance County on Cane Creek. Dixon's Mill there dates from 1753. An iron foundry was est. there about 1800 and, as late as 1879, was still in operation. Legend says the name Snow Camp was given the community by Cornwallis's soldiers, who camped there after the Battle of Guilford Courthouse during a heavy snow.

label: Snow Creek
description: rises in central Mitchell County and flows SW into North Toe River. Named for snow-white rocks in its bed.

label: Snow Creek
description: community in SW Mitchell County. Alt. approx. 2,600.

label: Snow Creek Township
description: NE Stokes County.

label: Snow Hill
description: county seat and town, central Greene County. Alt. 74. Authorized to be laid off 1811; inc. 1828. Named for a nearby plantation of the same name, which probably was named for a hill of white sand. John Becton in 1753 willed lands "called the Snow Hills" in the county to his son Michael. Shortly after the Revolution, the Shepherd family tried without success to promote a town at the site to be called Shepherdsburgh. The ancient Tuscarora Indian town Catechna was located nearby. Today the town produces lumber, milling, and textile products.

label: Snow Hill Crossroads
description: community in N Duplin County.

label: Snow Hill Township
description: central Greene County.

label: Snow Marsh
description: a series of small tidal marshes, SE Brunswick County in the Cape Fear River below Sunny Point.

label: Snow Mountain
description: N Avery County. Alt. 5,332.

label: Snow Point
description: SE Brunswick County, extends SE from the mainland into Cape Fear River at the mouth of Walden Creek and on the W side of Snow Marsh. Appears on the Collet map, 1770.

label: Snowball Gap
description: N Buncombe County SE of Little Snowball Mountain.

label: Snowball Mountain
description: NE Buncombe County at the S end of Little Fork Ridge. Also known as Big Snowball Mountain. Alt. 5,494. Named for the fact that in winter the peak is frequently covered at its crest by a low cloud, giving the appearance of a large snowball.

label: Snowbird Creek
description: rises in N Haywood County and flows SW into Pigeon River.

label: Snowbird Gap
description: central Graham County between Snowbird Creek and Atoah Creek.

label: Snowbird Mountain
description: on the Jackson-Macon county line.

label: Snowbird Mountains
description: extend across the E half of the Cherokee-Graham county line between Hawk Knob and Nantahala River. Max. alt. 4,743 at Teyahalee Bald.

label: Snowbird Top
description: on the Cherokee-Graham county line in the Snowbird Mountains. Alt. 3,882.

label: Snowden
description: community in N Currituck County. Post office est. 1883; named for second postmaster, Milton Snowden. Service discontinued, 1966. Alt. 9.

label: Snows Cut
description: canal in S New Hanover County approx. 1 3/5 mi. long, connects Myrtle Sound with Cape Fear River. It forms a part of the Intracoastal Waterway.

label: Snyder Creek
description: rises in N Lincoln County and flows SE into Anderson Creek.

label: Soakas Creek
description: rises in N Davidson County and flows W into S Forsyth County, where it enters South Fork Muddy Creek.

label: Soapstone Branch
description: rises in NW Swain County and flows SW into Eagle Creek at Horseshoe Bend.

label: Soapstone Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County and flows N into Scott Creek.

label: Soapstone Gap
description: N Jackson County on the NE end of Rocky Face Ridge.

label: Soapstone Knob
description: S Swain County near Marr Branch and Brush Creek.

label: Soapstone Mount
description: formerly a large pyrophyllite formation in NE Randolph County; for a number of years, the mineral was mined, crushed at nearby Staley, and shipped away for refining and use in talc products. A post office by the name operated there, 1851-1901.

label: Soapstone Ridge
description: N Transylvania County, extends NE from Rich Mountain to South Fork Mills River.

label: Society Parish
description: Church of England, Bertie County, est. with the formation of the county in 1722 and coextensive with it. Named for the Society for the Propagation of the Gospel. Previously the territory had been in SouthWest Parish, Chowan County, est. 1715. The parish had 930 white taxable inhabitants in 1767, described as "capable to maintain & willing to receive a Minister." Divided in 1727 to form Northwest Parish, which became Northampton County in 1741. The church for Society Parish was in the Merry Hill section of the county on Duckenfield land.

label: Soco Bald
description: on the Jackson-Swain county line near the head of Madcap Branch.

label: Soco Creek
description: rises in N Jackson County and flows SW into Oconaluftee River on the Jackson-Swain county line.

label: Soco Falls
description: on the head of Soco Creek in N Jackson County.

label: Soco Gap
description: on the Haywood-Jackson county line. Alt. 4,344. The most important passageway through Balsam Mountain for the Indians before the arrival of Europeans.

label: Soco Ridge
description: S Macon County between North Fork Coweeta Creek and the head of Hoglot Branch.

label: Soda Hill
description: community in NE Watauga County.

label: Sodom
description: community in N Madison County served by post office, 1898-1901. Laurel River and its tributaries drain the area. Local legend is that, after Presbyterian missionaries visited, name was changed to Revere, which see.

label: Sodom Branch
description: rises in SW Yancey County and flows NW into Indian Creek. Named for an early sawmill camp, at which prostitution, violence of all kinds, and drunkenness were common. Nearby settlers drew upon the Bible for an appropriate name for the camp.

label: Sodom Hollow
description: central Buncombe County, the valley through which French Broad River flows NW of Asheville toward Dryman Mountain. Named by an early circuit rider, who compared the rough pioneers living there with the inhabitants of the biblical Sodom and Gomorrah.

label: Sodom Mountain
description: central Madison County between Walnut Gap and Lumptown.

label: Soggy Hill Branch
description: rises in NE Swain County and flows S into Raven Fork.

label: Sokassa
description: See Rumbling Bald Mountain.

label: Solitude
description: See Ashland.

label: Solola Valley
description: community in N central Swain County on Noland Creek. The name comes from salola, the Cherokee Indian word for squirrel.

label: Solomons Creek
description: rises in S Richmond County and flows W into Pee Dee River.

label: Solray Gap
description: central Haywood County between Little Pine Mountain and Pigeon River.

label: Sols Creek
description: rises in E Jackson County and flows SW into Bear Creek Lake on the Tuckasegee River.

label: Somers Township
description: SE Wilkes County.

label: Somerset
description: community in central Person County. Est. 1895-1900 as Pick's or Pick's Siding, where lumber was brought by tramroad to be transferred to the railroad.

label: Somerset
description: plantation of Josiah Collins on Lake Phelps in Washington and Tyrrell Counties, developed between 1780 and 1788. At one time the plantation comprised more than 100,000 acres, 880 slaves, and about 20 buildings. The main house, Somerset Place, was built about 1830. The estate was abandoned and ruined before the end of the Civil War, and the property passed through various owners before it was sold at public auction in 1946. The state previously had purchased the mansion house and 16,628 acres in 1939. Somerset House has been restored and is open to the public as a State Historic Site. See also Pettigrew State Park.

label: Somerset Canal
description: SE Washington County, drains the waters of Lake Phelps into Scuppernong River and forms a portion of the Washington-Tyrrell county line. The canal, built by slave labor in 1787 at a cost of $30,000, was 20 ft. wide, 6 ft. deep, and 6 mi. long. Known for almost a century as Collins Canal for Josiah Collins, the plantation owner.

label: Somerton Creek
description: rises in Virginia and flows SW into NW Gates County, where it enters Chowan River.

label: Somey Creek
description: See Sumey Creek.

label: Sommey Creek
description: See Sumey Creek.

label: Sonoma
description: community in S Haywood County served by post office, 1878-1905.

label: Sophia
description: community in N Randolph County. Settled prior to 1779. Post office est. 1891. Probably named for Sophia Clement, local resident. Alt. 801.

label: Soracte
description: See Sarecta.

label: Sornook
description: See Mount Guyot.

label: Sorrell Creek
description: rises in S Haywood County and flows NW into Little East Fork Pigeon River.

label: Sorrell's Creek
description: rises in W Wake County and flows NW into Black Creek.

label: Sorrells Cove
description: E Haywood County between Brown Cove and Thickety Creek.

label: Sorrow Creek
description: appears on the Collet map, 1770, apparently rising in what is now N Davidson County and flowing W into South Fork in S Forsyth County.

label: Sossamon's Spring
description: See Sherrills Springs.

label: Soules Swamp
description: rises in N Columbus County and flows NE then SE into White Marsh.

label: Sound
description: community in NE Washington County served by post office, 1903-1908.

label: Sound, The
description: See Pamlico Sound.

label: Soundside
description: community in N Tyrrell County on the S side of Albemarle by post office, 1900-1901.

label: Sourwood Gap
description: on the Buncombe-McDowell county line NE of Montreat.

label: South Albemarle Township
description: E central Stanly County.

label: South Bay
description: in N Piney Island S of Rattan Bay, NE Carteret County. Approx. 1¾ mi. long and ½ mi. wide.

label: South Belmont
description: unincorporated outskirts of city of Belmont, SE Gaston County.

label: South Biltmore
description: former town in central Buncombe County; inc. 1895 but now within the corporate limits of Asheville. See also Biltmore.

label: South Blue Ridge Township
description: E Henderson County.

label: South Branch Cartledges Creek
description: rises in N Richmond County and flows SW into Cartledges Creek.

label: South Buffalo Creek
description: rises in S central Guilford County and flows NE to join North Buffalo Creek in NE Guilford County to form Buffalo Creek.

label: South Channel
description: NE Currituck County.

label: South Clinton Township
description: central Sampson County.

label: South Country Line Creek
description: rises in S Caswell County and flows NW into Country Line Creek.

label: South Cox Creek
description: rises in N Yancey County and flows SE into Jacks Creek.

label: South Creek
description: town in SE Beaufort County on a peninsula formed by the mouths of Bond and Muddy Creeks as they enter Pamlico River. Settled prior to 1794, when it was known as Stanton-Harrold for two men who operated a sawmill there. Apparently known as Harold in the early nineteenth century and as Oregon (for the first steamboat to come up the Pamlico River—see Oregon Inlet) about the middle of the century. Post office, 1851-1954, operated as South Creek. Inc. 1883 as Stanton. Inc. 1925 as South Creek, but no longer active in municipal affairs.

label: South Crowders Creek
description: rises in S Gaston County and flows SE into Crowders Creek.

label: South Deep Creek
description: rises in W Yadkin County and flows SE and E to join North Deep Creek in forming Deep Creek.

label: South Dividing Creek
description: See South Creek.

label: South Double Creek
description: rises in W Stokes County and flows NE into Dan River.

label: South Fayetteville
description: unincorporated outskirts of city of Fayetteville in central Cumberland County.

label: South Flat River
description: rises in SW Person County and flows SE into Flat River.

label: South Fork
description: See South Fork Catawba River.

label: South Fork Beech Creek
description: rises in E Graham County and flows NW into Beech Creek.

label: South Fork Catawba River
description: is formed in central Catawba County by the junction of Jacob Fork and Henry Fork. It flows S through Catawba County, S across central Lincoln County, and SE through central Gaston County to enter Catawba River in SE Gaston County. Also known locally in various places as South Fork, South Fork River, and Little Catawba River. Appears as South Fork of the Catawba River on the Collet map, 1770.

label: South Fork Cattail Creek
description: rises in S Yancey County and flows NW to join North Fork Cattail Creek in forming Cattail Creek.

label: South Fork Creek
description: See South Fork [Cane Creek].

label: South Fork Crooked Creek
description: rises in W Union County and flows NE to join North Fork Crooked Creek in forming Crooked Creek.

label: South Fork Flat Creek
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows NE into Flat Creek.

label: South Fork Hawk Branch
description: rises in N Yancey County and flows W to join Middle Fork Hawk Branch in forming Hawk Branch.

label: South Fork Jones Creek
description: rises in SW Anson County and flows NE to join North Fork Jones Creek in forming Jones Creek.

label: South Fork Little Horse Creek
description: rises near Apple Grove in NW Ashe County and flows E into Little Horse Creek.

label: South Fork Little River
description: rises in N Orange County and flows SE into NW Durham County, where it joins North Fork Little River in forming Little River.

label: South Fork Mountain Creek
description: rises in E Catawba County and flows E to join North Fork Mountain Creek in forming Mountain Creek.

label: South Fork New River
description: is formed in S Watauga County approx. 2 mi. SE of Boone by the confluence of East Fork, Flannery Fork, and Middle Fork. It meanders NE to join North Fork New River in forming New River on the Ashe-Alleghany county line. See also East Fork [South Fork New River]; Flannery Fork [South Fork New River]; Middle Fork [South Fork New River].

label: South Fork Rapier Mill Creek
description: rises in SW Cherokee County and flows SE and NE into Rapier Mill Creek after dipping into Fanin County, Ga.

label: South Fork Reddies River
description: rises in W Wilkes County and flows SE into Middle Fork Reddies River.

label: South Fork River
description: See South Fork Catawba River.

label: South Fork Rock Creek
description: rises in S Yancey County and flows NE into Rock Creek.

label: South Fork Township
description: W Tyrrell County.

label: South Fork Upper Creek
description: rises in S Yancey County and flows SE to join Middle Fork Upper Creek in forming Upper Creek.

label: South Fork Yadkin River
description: See Mill Fork; South Yadkin River.

label: South Fork [Big Pine Creek]
description: rises in S Madison County and flows N to join North Fork in forming Big Pine Creek.

label: South Fork [Cane Creek]
description: rises in N Chatham County and flows NE into S Alamance County, where it enters Cane Creek. Known also as South Fork Creek.

label: South Fork [Carvers Branch]
description: rises in S Mitchell County and flows SW into Carvers Branch.

label: South Fork [James Cathey's Mill Creek]
description: See Sloans Creek.

label: South Fork [Rattle Snake Creek]
description: rises in central Caswell County and flows NW to join North Fork of Rattle Snake Creek in forming Rattle Snake Creek.

label: South Fork [Second Creek]
description: See Back Creek.

label: South Fork [Skeenah Creek]
description: rises in S Macon County and flows NE to join North Fork [Skeenah Creek] in forming Skeenah Creek.

label: South Gaston
description: former town in NW Halifax County on Roanoke River. Chartered 1895; charter repealed 1907. Appears as So. Gaston on the Colton map, 1861, but as Gaston on the Kerr map, 1882. It was at South Gaston that passengers on the Raleigh and Gaston Railroad took a ferry across the Roanoke River to the town of Gaston before a railroad bridge spanned the river. The community of Thelma is now at the site.

label: South Gastonia
description: community in S Gaston County adjacent to the city of Gastonia. The former communities of Myers, Pinkney, and Ridge (originally Pleasant Ridge) are now considered to be parts of South Gastonia. Alt. 772.

label: South Harper Creek
description: rises in SE Avery County in Boone Wildlife Management Area and flows SE to join North Harper Creek near the Caldwell County line to form Harper Creek.

label: South Henderson
description: unincorporated outskirts of city of Henderson in S central Vance County.

label: South Hominy
description: community in SW Buncombe County near the junction of Glady Fork and South Hominy Creek.

label: South Hominy Creek
description: rises in SW Buncombe County near Brooks Gap and flows NE into Hominy Creek.

label: South Hyco Creek
description: rises in N Orange and SE Caswell Counties and flows NE into Person County, where it joins North Hyco Creek in forming Hyco River. The part of South Hyco Creek that lies in Caswell County is sometimes called Sugartree Creek.

label: South Lake
description: artificial pond on Long Creek in S Vance County. Covers 14 acres, with max. depth of 15 ft. Originally named Beckham Millpond and was formed sometime in the nineteenth century. Name was changed in early 1940s, when the lake was bought by a social club. The mill is still standing; lake is used for recreation (fishing, swimming, boating). The name appeared on the soil survey map of 1913 as Beckon Mill.

label: South Leopard Creek
description: an inlet of North River into the mainland S of North Leopard Creek in E Carteret County.

label: South Lowell
description: community in NW Durham County between Buffalo and Horse Creeks on the N side of North Fork Little River.

label: South Mills
description: town in NW Camden County; inc. 1883, but not active in municipal affairs. Prior to 1800 the community was known as New Lebanon because the junipers that formerly grew in the area adjacent to the Dismal Swamp suggested the biblical reference to the tall cedars of Lebanon. Post office was New Lebanon from 1797 until 1839, when the name was changed to South Mills because waters from a spillway at the S end of the Dismal Swamp Canal were used to turn wheels of mills there.

label: South Mills Township
description: N Camden County.

label: South Mountains
description: a range of mountains extending from NE Rutherford County into SW Burke and N Cleveland Counties. Known by the Cherokee Indians as Oakanoahs

label: South Mountains Wildlife Management Area
description: in SE Burke County. 17,700 acres. Jointly owned by private interests and the town of Morganton. Est. 1952-53.

label: South Muddy Creek
description: rises in SE McDowell County and flows NE to join North Muddy Creek near the Burke County line to form Muddy Creek.

label: South Point
description: community in SE Gaston County served by post office, 1846-1902.

label: South Point Township
description: SE Gaston County.

label: South Prong
description: rises in S Transylvania County and flows NE into Little River.

label: South Prong Creek
description: rises in E Guilford County and flows NE into SW Alamance County, where it enters Stinking Quarter Creek.

label: South Prong Lewis Fork Creek
description: rises in W Wilkes County and flows SE approx. 9 mi. to join North Prong Lewis Fork Creek in forming Lewis Fork Creek. Yates Mountain lies between the two prongs.

label: South Prong Stanley Creek
description: rises in NE Gaston County and flows SE into Dutchmans Creek.

label: South Prong Turkey Creek
description: rises in N Transylvania County and flows SE to join North Prong Turkey Creek in forming Turkey Creek.

label: South Prong West Branch
description: rises in N Mecklenburg County and flows SE into Rocky River.

label: South Prong [Clarks Creek]
description: rises in N Mecklenburg County and flows E to join North Prong in forming Clarks Creek.

label: South Prong [Glady Fork]
description: rises in S Transylvania County on N slopes of Sassafras Mountain and flows NE and then NW to join West Prong [Glady Fork] in forming Glady Fork. Also known as Kirkendall Creek.

label: South Prong [Wet Ash Swamp]
description: rises in Green Swamp, W Brunswick County, and flows NW into Wet Ash Swamp.

label: South River
description: community in N Rowan County on South Fork Yadkin River. Settled about 1800. Served by post office, 1860-1907.

label: South River Township
description: SW Sampson County.

label: South Rocky Mount
description: the S part of Rocky Mount in W Edgecombe County.

label: South Rodanthe
description: See Waves.

label: South Salisbury
description: unincorporated outskirts of city of Salisbury, E central Rowan County.

label: South Second Creek
description: rises in S Rowan County and flows NE into High Rock Lake. Appears as Lower Second Creek on the Collet map, 1770; as Dutch Second Creek on the Price map, 1808, and the MacRae map, 1833; as Second Creek on the Kerr map, 1882; and as South Second Creek on recent maps.

label: South Shoal Creek
description: See Shoal Creek.

label: South Shore Parish
